text: Gee Whiz Everyone Wins! Experiment: Using Random Samples to Estimate a Population

In Problem 1.1, we looked at samples representing the population. For example, we looked at samples that estimated the proportion of child and adults in the population. In How Likely Is It, we learned a process of selecting so that each outcome has the same chance of being chosen. A good sampling plan is one that gives each member of the population the same chance of being selected. To do this, we can use concepts from probability, such as equally likely outcomes. A random sampling plan gives each member of a population an equally likely chance of being included in the sample.
